Reviews.Title: “Very good for a basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lina S
Reviews.Content: I visit Barcelona once per month for work and I have tried many hotels. This one is very convenient and good value for money if you ate looking for a descent 3* hotel. I was impressed overalls. Very good breakfast and very friendly staff. Internet rather slow but ok to check emails etc - it's free. Would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, however”
Reviews.Author: 000eric000
Reviews.Content: When the Mobile World Congress is happening is Barcelona, hotel prices are trippled. So difficult to go price/quality ratio Hotel is very well located, near beach, Ramblas, restaurants,.. Nice team and Breakfast is ok, but not excellent (no fresh Orange juice, Jamon of low quality, coffee - dont even try it) Rooms are very small (was in 201) with view on a wall. You can hear your neighboor going to the toilet and taking a shower. However mostly enerving is the sound of the elevator. So avoid 201 Bathroom: when taking shower, don't look up or around, it could spoil your day. So, there are much better hotels in Barcelona, but Congress situation.

Reviews.Title: “Hesperia Metropol”
Reviews.Author: ALLAN33330
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel with friends. We found it to be in a great location 5 mins walk to La Rambles & 2 mins to sea front. Many tapas bars/ restaurants close by, Picasso round corner & Sailor restaurant on front were really good value. Hotel rooms clean & comfortable although our rooms were a little on cool side no matter what setting A/C was on. Would stay again because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiskyRich
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel after staying here a couple of years ago. I had booked three double rooms and one triple for some friends of mine for our annual weekend away. However, at last minute one of my friends was unable to come. When I arrived at the reception, I told the receptionist we wouldn't need a third bed in one of the rooms and he promptly removed it from our invoice for the weekend. This was a most welcome and pleasant surprise. The hotel itself is much the same as before, in that it is smart, very clean and perfectly located for a great weekend in Barcelona. You are 5 minutes walk from Las Ramblas and 2 minutes from the marina. The rooms are all in good order and I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay. A little tip for getting there: If you are flying in to Barcelona BCN Terminal 2, don't waste money on a taxi unless you have a lot of heavy bags. Take one of the many blue buses outside the terminal. They will have A2 on the front display panel. A return ticket (valid for 9 days) is €9.15. It is approximately a 15 minute ride to the last stop which is Plaça de Catalunya. From here you walk straight down Las Ramblas (which is a real eye opener if you've never been) and take the very last left before you get to the roundabout (which has a 60 metre high Columbus monument on it, so you can't miss it). The street is called Carrer Ample and it is 5 minutes down there on the left, just past a beautiful old church. In all, it is a really enjoyable 15 minute walk from where the bus drops you off.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Feenabermingham
Reviews.Content: This hotels biggest asset is its location. We booked two room, one each, due to it's excellent price. My room was extremely small & really only suitable for one person while my mothers room was slightly bigger. The beds were comfortable & clean as was the room itself. I would not recommend this hotel if you want to spend time there. However, who goes to a fabulous place like Barcelona to sit in a hotel room. We will definitely return to this hotel due to its convenience to all central attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for us”
Reviews.Author: Norrisg24
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel, reasonably priced, excellent location close to the sea front, La Ramblas, cathederal etc. We stayed in a large group and didnt use it for more than a place to sleep. The walls are thin and the noise from the street can be very loud long into the night - in some of the rooms. We didnt eat there but there are better value breakfasts to be had virtually anywhere in the city. Spent a lot of time in Ryans Irish bar across the road which is excellent and very lively. Plenty of shops and restaurants in all directions. Would probably find a better facility if we went to Barcelona again, as a couple, but for a large party having fun it was ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Drdoggo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Great location, 2 min walk to La Ramblas, also short walk to waterfront and Picasso museum. Lots of nice cafes and restaurants on same street- would highly recommend Sensi directly opposite-amazing tapas, reasonable prices and v friendly staff! Room big enough but quite dark, no tea/coffee making facilities or phone but free wifi worked well. Had an interior room so no street noise but could hear nearby showers/toilets flushing which seemed very loud. Main con was customer service- my husband managed to stain a nice shirt-we went back to hotel straight after dinner, soaked stain then took it to reception to get it dry cleaned. Told it would be done following day and ready to collect day after that. When husband went to get it 36 hours later he saw it hanging behind reception still damp from soaking. The lady said she didn't know why it hadnt been cleaned, did not say sorry or seem slightest bit apologetic and couldn't even guarantee if could be done that day! Was eventually cleaned but again a different girl on collection didn't apologise for the mess up. Overall ok for price and great location but rude staff left a bad impression of the place.

Reviews.Title: “To stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Bittelit1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for a good price, and central in the old town. And some nice restaurants and bars nearby:-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: YvonneNX
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was very worried about my trip. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. The street is not as previously described as seedy. It is a pleasant street close to La Rambla. It is ideally situated for a trip to Barcelona as it is central to everywhere. I found sleeping here no problem- however, I was usually out until 4AM! The room itself was spacious with A/C and a good size minibar which was perfect for keeping our items cool. The beds were very comfortable- we had twins pushed together so very spacious. Plenty of blankets if needed and very clean. The room itself was also immaculately clean as was the bathroom which was a 4-piece, very clean and with a decent shower. Lots of towels available in the bathroom and usual touches such as soap etc. The reception staff were extremely helpful and knowledgable- both in Spanish and English. The TV was small but who cares!!! It had a picture and good sound quality- people don't go away to watch TV!!! This is a 3* hotel but my experience here means it rivals some of the 4* hotels I've stayed in. Overall, a very nice hotel situated in the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Main reason for "very good" is super location for average hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJ_DK
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay on this hotel in October: Very good location; small rooms; breakfast locally; pretty noisy door; window etc

Reviews.Title: “Good location for pre-cruise in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: boozin-n-cruizin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quiet side street and was walking distance to the waterfront area with many shops and restaurants. The room was small but comfortable and we slept well after our long oversees flight. You can get the buffet breakfast for an extra charge- it is the European type breakfast- breads, meats, cheeses, fruit and pastries. It is only a short cab ride to the port if you are taking a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Central but not clean.”
Reviews.Author: pallinadineve
Reviews.Content: Even if I was happy with the location of this hotel, not too far from the Ramblas. I have to express my disappointment with the bad smell that was caming out of the bathroom costantly even at night. No one helped us with the luggages and it was hard to bring them up since the elevator wasn`t working at that time and also the stairs were small and high.At night was hard to sleep since my room was on the street and young kids were staying out until the morning and were very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, quiet and in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Katkirbs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is essentially in the Puerta del Sol. Although our room faced the bustling street our room was surprisingly and pleasantly quiet. It is situated a couple of yards from the metro stop. Many of Madrids attractions are winin walking distance as well as many places for tapas and sangria. The bathroom was beautiful and the room was large.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Barcelona Spain, Port Vell and Beach”
Reviews.Author: YoYo3668
Reviews.Content: We are from Greensboro N.C and we picked Spain for our honeymoon also we took the mediterainian Cruise for 12 days leaving from Port Vell. I was shocked when we got to the hotel it was very unique and trendy. The room was small but it had a window bacony that was very cool ,but it was very much a hot spot. It was very conveint to shops, food, local bars and the beach. I had traveled to Spain before and stayed in Malaga. Malaga was fun , but Bacelona is the most historical and the locals are awesome people. We made friends at a local bar MONDE 27. I am looking forward to our next trip it was the best trip ever!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, hotel's alright too!”
Reviews.Author: Aoife B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the best locations I could have asked for, so close to Las Ramblas without the noise! We got the trip really cheap through lastminute.ie so I can't really complain much ;op The staff were very helpful with excellent English. The room was small enough which was not a problem, it was clean and had cable TV even if it was in Catalan, the air-conditioning saved our lives! There was a few things wrong with the room; the mini fridge didn't work (didn't intend on using it anyway) there was mildewy spots around the air-conditioning from condensation but no big deal, overall I can't complain because it was such a steal for us! I will definitely be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gusdmh
Reviews.Content: Location was great as I was going on a cruise and the ports were nearby. As for quality, it was clean. However, the rooms (and my family stayed in four of them pre/post cruise) were very musty and A/C hardly worked. It wasn't so hot but the musty air in the rooms was bothersome. As for location...awesome. Ramblas was nearby, as well as the Metro. Very convenient to get to other sites such as La Sagrada Familia and Corte Ingles (wife wanted to shop).

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem off the Main Las Ramblas Drag”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Eye_USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel came in really handy. My girlfriend and I were visiting Barcelona for the first time. Only problem was that our flight did not get in until after midnight, and we did not want to spend money for a complete day at a hotel if we were just going to sleep for about 7 hours. Our plan was to arrive at the Hesperia Metropol reception sometime around 1:00 a.m. and beg them to hold onto our luggage until they could should check us into our room that afternoon during traditional check-in hours. Mary at the front desk was a complete doll. She could see we were exhausted from traveling and took mercy on us. She booked us into our room a full 12 hours in advance of the usual check-in time. She saved us from a long night and an early morning of 5 Hour Energy bottles, endless cups of coffee and numerous cans of Red Bull. We got into our room around 1:30 a.m. and slept until morning with complete comfort. If not for Mary, we would have never gotten our body clocks right. We were able to wake up at a decent hour and really explore the city to its fullest. We were in room #110 and this was very nice, but the air conditioning left something to be desired. The ceilings were high and there was plenty of closet space. But there was absolutely no view. The only window in the room faced out toward an enclosed landing. The bathroom was nice with a big tub. They put out complimentary soaps and bath gels and even toothpaste, which was a real bonus as we were officially out of it by that point in our trip. Hot and cold water worked well. There was a fridge but nothing could be put inside of it because the hotel had filled it with all the things they had hoped to sell. I also don't think it was turned on because everything inside was luke warm at best. The real beauty of this hotel is the location. It can be tough to find Carrer Ample if you are using public transportation and arriving after midnight. Somehow we did. But the Hesperia Metropol's proximity to Las Ramblas (the main drag) and the beach made it worth the price. You are a five minute walk from the beginning of Las Ramblas. You are also a twenty minute walk from the beach. The train is also about ten minutes away. There are many restaurants and bars nearby. There is a very young demographic which stays out very late in Barcelona. They gave me and my girlfriend a perplexed look when they saw us carrying our luggage in on a Tuesday night. There is no free computer for guests to use. If you want to check your email or surf the net, you have to pay to use the computer in the lobby. This is not all bad, but it seems like a cheap way to make a few extra bucks. The hotel can be easy to miss as all the buildings are pretty close together and little sunlight makes its way onto the street. But if you are like us, you are not going to spend a majority of your time in a hotel room when you have the lovely city of Barcelona beckoning for you to take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- price was right- walking distance of Ramblas and Marina-but...”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon504
Reviews.Content: Price was right for this hotel- $140 including tax for 3 days and got breakfast too! The food is adequate and they did go out of their way for those wanting a special order- remember that you are in a foreign country and some things do not translate well - so ask the wait staff before you order eggs benedict and such. Walking distance of the Ramblas, easy access to bus rides- walk to the marina. Room was small but clean and linens were fresh and hot water was plentiful in the shower. If you are a TV watcher, bring your lap-top as channels are very limited and of course except for BBC news- Spanish speaking. The area is friendly and there are food stores around for quick meals such as coffee, snacks, etc. We were in the room to sleep, shower and change clothing, so we were not worried about "amenities" - if you are, go to a luxury hotel and pay extra. We did take advantage of the safe in our room and recommend that everyone do so. The staff was helpful and the internet cafe worked well- you pay by the minute so you may want to keep "web talk" brief. The only bad part about this hotel for us was the noise at night- as Americans our night stops around 10 and Barcelona's starts around then party goers and tourists who are out for a good time at night. We live in the country so the "city sounds" seemed very close for us. Of course there are deliveries made at an early hour also and we weren't use to that either. All in all , we would come back to this hotel and ask for a quiet floor

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would go back”
Reviews.Author: lamb_bob
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my friend last year, we arrived late at night and the taxi driver dropped us off outside the door. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely and clean. We had a good sized twin room overlooking the quadrangle but we didnt have any noise or problems. Once we had freshened up a bit we went out for a drink. The street is quite dark and there are lots of locals but dont let this put you off. We were two (nice looking) women on our own and had no problems. We did not have breakfast in the hotel preferring the little coffee shop a few doors down which served amazing coffee and pastries. The hotel felt very safe and about a 20 min walk away from the beach and maybe 10 minutes away from the Aquarium and lots of lovely shops and restarants around the same area. Ramblas is maybe 10 minute walk away depending on the heat and we had an amazing time looking at all the stools and drinking fresh juice for sale in the famous market at the end of Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: newwell16
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Wednesday night and were warmly greeted by the wonderful hotel receptionist/night Manager - Juan. The hotel was perfectly located right in the heart of the Old town/Gothic Quarter of Barcelona. The benefit of this is that the hotel is well placed in the centre of activity; the downside is that it could be considered too noisy for some. For us it was fine and we were there on a public bank holiday. The room was spacious and clean, with a small balcony overlooking Carrer Ample, 2 large twin beds and air condioning. The staff were receptive, responsive and helpful, particularly Juan, who went out of his way to ensure that our stay in Barcelona was pleasant. We would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and if we return to Barcelona would stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Really good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Charlie7fR
Reviews.Content: Dont get fool by the location reviews, the hotel is in a really nice location at wlaking distance from the metro, beach. You can also find really good restaurants and markets. The rooms are really small but clean and confortable. They have free internet. We boooked in advance and the price was amazing. I will recomend this hotel for its price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cocoa123
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before staying at this Hotel. I was really forced after waiting so long to book a room. We had the most miserable night. It was very noisy from the Bars across from the hotel. It remined me of Bourbon Street in New Orleans where I live. We were in barcelona for a cruise, and was looking for a reasonable priced hotel close to the pier and La Rambla. Don't be fooled. Run from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and convenient”
Reviews.Author: RachelEFMY
Reviews.Content: Convenient for Las Ramblas and about 5 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station. Room was small and "no frills" , but it was clean and secure. Plenty of places nearby to pick up snacks or to have a meal. It's a good low budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Kirkm
Reviews.Content: Central location ideal for trips around Barcelona and easy access to sea front and bars. The only isse we found was the terrible noise in the street outside until about 1am most nights. Free internet was good. Tip: bakery next door is great for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Still okay”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: Owing to bank holiday flight change had an extra night in Barcelona so managed to get night booked here for 99 euro. Last stayed here in February and not much has changed. Location is great , smaller room this time on 4th floor (top floor) over looking side street so had small juliet balcony which was better than overlooking central air con ducts. Bathrooms all seem to be the same which ever room you have but always clean. Still no material change over to NH format but for price & location very good value Did not have hotel breakfast as plenty of bakeries/coffee on Ample for 2 eur. Ate at La Lluna on Santa Anna which was superb value for money, well worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “brill position”
Reviews.Author: parobbo
Reviews.Content: Average hotel - but good value for price - position convenient for everything - shopping, beach, public transport. Staff helpful when asked anything - yes noisy at night but Barcelona doesn't sleep at night!!! Clean rooms and secure - safe in rooms. Happy to keep luggage when checking out if needed to collect later. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Location!”
Reviews.Author: Linzbe
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for my birthday break away as it was in the centre of the city and the price was a bargain! We landed in Barcelona at 10am, taxi from the airport was 22 Euros. We arrived at the Hotel at about 11:30am on Monday 2nd May, our room was ready so we checked straight in. Staff are very friendly and speak excellent english. Our room was at the front of the hotel which over looked the street, I had read some reviews before we went which said it was very noisey. The only noise that disturbed us was the bins being emptied at about 2am on the first night we stayed, other than that we slept well. We only paid for breakfast for one morning (8 euros if booked in advance with hotel reception) If you're really really hungry then go for it, but I wouldn't say it was worth the money. Also if you go out of the hotel and turn left there is a gorgeous little cafe a few doors up, I would definatly recommend it! Also straight across from the hotel is a Tapas Bar called Sensi, they do tapas with a moden twist. GO THERE! The food is amazing & the staff are excellent!! Location of the hotel is amazing! Right in the heart of the Gothic Quarter & only a 15min walk to the main plaza, where all the Tour Buses go from, which I would highly recommend doing! We didn't have any problems with the hotel at all! Drinks in Mini Bar were replaced ASAP, we asked for extra pillows in the morning and they were in our room by the afternoon. Bathroom was large, with Shower, bath, toilet, BD, hairdryer & towels. Balconly was small but wasn't a problem, didn't spend too much time in the room but it was a good size, beds were comfy and also had a free safe in the wardrobe. We would definatly stay here again!! Excellent location, excellent price and great staff :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy with paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ArohanuiLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great part of town very close to everything but the rooms were sparse with no proper window, the walls are very thin and the hotel noisy

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: sikc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! walking distance to the beach, port, Gothic Quarter, Las Ramblas, subway station, Mercado Boqueria, and more. Loved to be able to get up and go. The first night we had the room to Ample street although it had a cute balcony, it was really loud. we could hear everyone on the street and it was Friday night. The next day we asked if we could changed rooms and they were nice enough to do so. we asked the front desk staff for a place to eat lunch and he sent us to a place around the corner that was cheap and had great food. The only downside is that the mattress was really hard.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY - ILL BE BACK!!!”
Reviews.Author: picscartoons
Reviews.Content: I totally fumbled and forget to check references when I made plans for our vacation to Barcelona. We had picked this hotel and a few weeks later, after reading the reviews, I seemed to work myself up into panic-mode, after hearing about stolen money and the neighborhood of the hotel. Well, I can honestly say that my fears were VERY quickly put aside once we got there. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly, eager to map out our next destination for us. As for the room, yes, it was small, but our days really were spent sight-seeing and except to sleep we werent in it. Location - you cant top it. It is right, smack dab, in the middle of the action! OK, OK, now I wouldnt be fair if I didnt list a few negatives here. The worst part of this hotel was the smells on the ground floor. I believe that this place is built on a dump or sewer line that filters into the main lobby. We stayed on the fourth floor, so it didnt bother us there, only when we walked in. Another negative would be the proximity to the next building. As we looked out of the window, we could see right into the apartment across from us. (we had to be only ten feet away!) But this aside, the stay was very pleasant, and we'd be back again. As far as Barcelona, a few words of advice. Keep valuables in the hotel safe. We didn't lose anything, but at the flea market, my wife's bag was slashed hoping something would fall during a crowded section. Another word of advice is get your metro pass for 10-rides rather than individually. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: UncleDom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. Hotel is perfectly fine, good location. Price was not too bad , paid 79 euro a night direct from NH website Room was large with 2 twin beds. Perfectly comfortable for 2 nights. This is a Hesperia hotel not a NH so it is not as classy as NH's are. I have stayed here before and nothing has really changed apart from a few new soaps & gels. Towels are still Hesperia. large bathroom with tub, nice grey suite, again all fine. Owing to mixup had free breakfast which was okay Usual cold cuts, cereal fruit & pastries, Glad it was free probably would not pay for it unless it was included in rate. There is a bakery/coffee shop a few doors down which does good coffee & crossiants. Would stay again but always on the look out for something better but for price & location it is good - would not pay more than 99 euro a night though. Security was not a problem. Do try at eat at Café de L'Academia, it is only about 5/10 minutes walk away by Jaume 1 , it is so wonderful ( the food is fab) also try Les Quinze Nuits in Plaza Real,never a bad meal there.

Reviews.Title: “The best option for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: tsiger
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas in Barcelona and we stayed 5 nights in this hotel. The location is just excellent. La Rambla is just 2 minutes away. We were given a non-smoking room but as we are both smoker we were transfered to another room immediately without any problems. The room didn't have a view but that wasn't a problem for us. It was clean and exactly the size that a couple needs. A free safe box was provided for free. The wifi connection worked all days without any problems. Staff was always helpful and answered any questions we had. i don't think i'm gonna look for another hotel for our next trip to Barcelona. Considering the price we paid it was a lot more of what we could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sdpatel701
Reviews.Content: My booking company accidentally booked me for two reservations instead of one. The manager at the hotel was completely insensitive to my situation and said there was nothing he could do. Any decent hotel would have cancelled the second reservation that was booked in error, especially when I only needed one. Not this hotel. They made me pay for both reservations. I had to fight them for 4 months after returning home just to get my money back. Do not stay here - there's better hotels in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: gogirlone
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is clean & sufficient for a pre-cruise stay which was our purpose. It was close to the port and it only cost us 14.85 Euro for the ride to the ship. Since I speak very little Spanish, I enjoyed speaking English with the staff. We were offered breakfast for 8.50 Euro if we agreed on it upon check -in. Because we would be rushed to get to the ship, we took this offer. We ate breakfast in the breakfast room of the hotel. It is just OK. It was the first time I ever ate white rice w/red peppers for breakfast! The milk & cold cuts were warm and did not taste fresh. The pastries & fruit were good. We took the room at the front w/the Juliet balcony and I have to agree with other reviewers, it is VERY NOISY. But I knew what to expect & still asked for it because I wanted to take pictures off the balcony and I was interested to know what the locals were doing. I'm a people watcher. There are alot of bars and restaurants across the street directly below the hotel. This is a one way street & no way for cars to pass, so when an inconsiderate driver decides to park his car in the road and go inside a bar, all the cars behind will sit there and blow their horns. It never stopped until about 4 AM, but then the trash people come twice on Sat nites. Once to pick up bins and then again to pick up the hundreds of trash bags that the residents and others toss on the sidewalk. Like most of Europe, Barcellona has a huge grafiti problem and the streets smell like sewer gas. Pray for a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ads_213
Reviews.Content: The service was great, we arrived early however they let us check in as our room was ready. The hotel is on a typical Barcelona backstreet, but once inside is very smart and comfortable. The location couldn't be better, at the bottom of la Ramblas and near the Harbour, only a short walk to the beach. The rooms are clean and well equipped, air conditioning was a godsend. The bathroom door was shaded glass which didn't stay shut or lock, which wasn't a problem for us as a couple but could be an issue for some people. We didn't Have a view but for the price it was fine. In conclusion I would recommend this hotel and stay here again, fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room in questionable area”
Reviews.Author: BCN-JAM
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at this hotel four times since 2005, and while it was never a great hotel it was a decent value. But now the area around the hotel has changed. It’s dirty and noisy and there are plenty of questionable people hanging around at all hours. The police patrolled the area one night while I was at a nearby restaurant. I asked the waiter why and he told me that there have been thefts of handbags and backpacks. In addition, the Metropol is not a quiet hotel. Even if you get an interior room, the walls are thin and you can hear a lot more than you’ll want to hear. I’ll be staying somewhere else the next time I’m in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “police are investigating the crimes in this place”
Reviews.Author: franklin66
Reviews.Content: yeah the rooms are fine, internet is not very good, but i was always a little creeped out by the staff and on the last night was also robbed. Just the cash within an hour of leaving the hotel. the person at the desk was very defensive, discouraged me from going to the police. for good reason since the police were well aware of what is going on in the place and knew it well. when someone comes into your room on the last night with no signs of entry and has time to open up all your stuff, remove the cash and put everything back in place, you know it's an inside job. save yourself the trouble of staying here, it costs too much.

Reviews.Title: “do you really want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: fdafd
Reviews.Content: i have recently staid in this hotel and well it was not a bad place, but you might change your mind after this. i just got robed, no not in the street my bedroom got hack well i wasn't there. but strangely they only took my money, and strangely i had to leave tomorrow morning early and the only on that new that was the receptionist new that and also are connection with another room that is in the other side of the room when we were out for a walk that took an hour in a half. so think it again if you want to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BjornT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few hundred meters from the Rambla. If you are just looking for a clean room & shower, centrally located, for your stay in Barcelona, this is it. It you need a hotel with swimming pool, exercise room or fancy bars and restaurants, keep looking. We had a room facing a back alley and experienced some noise, but within acceptable levels. The reseptionists were friendly and helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel since we think we could get a better breakfast for the same money in nearby cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KevNShelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location 5 minutes walk from the bottom of La Ramblas. We found staff very friendly and helpful - reception staff all spoke very good English. The room was quite spacious and very clean. Storage space was minimal - only a small closet with 6 hangers (not great for 2 female travellers!). Our only complaint was that our room was right next to the lift and so was quite noisy during the night. We were at the back of the hotel so no noise from the street. Buffet breakfast was very good - we used it on the last morning and is good value compared to some of the cafes we went to! Would definitey stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No security, no internet.”
Reviews.Author: LuisFelipeR
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hesperia Metropol Barcelona was frustrating. We were stolen inside the room. After a tour day, when we got to the room and all my money was gone. I agree with the hotel when they say they are not responsible for it because I did not hire a locker. But what angered me was that I called their attention to the fact that there was a theft and security should be strengthened and they simply did nothing. There is no control over who enters and leaves the hotel. In addition, the wi´fi connection doesn't work. The impression is that they do not care about the opinion that the guests will have about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxgolf71
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Metropol is a very good hotel between the Port Well and the Barrio Gotico. Central position very well located just 5min. to the Ramblas. The staff is very professional and very helpfull,for any request and advise speak with Fernando(Night Shift), the rooms are very clear, the only black dot is a little bit noisy from the "Carrer" side...but your are in Barca' to live the nights as well...enjoy! Max

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrejflorida
Reviews.Content: great hotel with nice rooms and good breakfast. It has a great location in it is a good value for your money. Although you hear noise from the street all night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great price, but noisy!”
Reviews.Author: SussexAdventurers
Reviews.Content: I staed at this hotel recently for one night. It is conveniently located near Barceloneta (beach areas) and the French railway centre, on an almost impossibly narrow street that still allows vehicular access. The hotel itself was just fine. Nicely appointed reception area, good breakfast buffet etc. My room was a small single, but what do you expect for £35? At least it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The a/c wasn't working, but this was not critical in November. The only, but really significant, problem, was noise. There seemed to be absolutely zero noise insulation from the outside world to my room (yes, I did check and the window was closed). There was noisy traffic (mostly motor cycles) running through the night and, even worse, loud groups of chatting/shouting people walking by as they left bars/clubs in the area. This was virtually non-stop until 4am. Needless to say I got virtually no sleep. If you are a heavy sleeper/not disturbed by noise then you may be OK. However, if you are a light sleeper, like me, be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travn0w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights & we found the rooms to be very clean and well maintained, the staff very helpful, and the location very good. It is true that there were some noises at night from the outside (drunks, music, etc.), but if you close the window, it's not that loud. Overall, however, we really enjoyed our stay there & would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended !!!”
Reviews.Author: famezzz
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel.The hotel is in a very good location. Metro and Ramblas street is 5 minutes walking. Port Vell, Picasso Museum, Cathedral and other monuments are also walking distance. We asked for a quiet (interior) double bed room, which they gave us. The room was clean with all the comforts (save box, mini bar, hairdryer, air condition, tv, etc), but the only negative it had that it was very small. We didn't had breakfast because we didn't asked to, and it wasn't in the price. We were impressed about the staff who were very very helpful and friendly. If we visit Barcelona again it will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VidiCi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights at the end of April. This renovated hotel is very centrally located, in a narrow side street of the Ramblas. Also just a few minutes from the beach. The room was clean and all features where available. I had a room at the interior, it was very quiet and the bed was comfortable. In front of the hotel was a busy pub, so beware of this if you book this hotel. I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, it wasn't included in the rate. I preffered to have my coffee and bocadillo in one of the local small bars in the street, very cheap and tasty. I already stayed 7 times in Barcelona, but this was the best one in this price category so far, so next time I certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiskyRich
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent value hotel. It is actually rated 3 star and not 2, but we paid 75 euros a night per room for a twin room. The location is excellent as it is only a 3 minute walk to La Ramblas. The hotel has a lovely reception, with very friendly staff. The rooms are small, but very clean. Wonderfully strong showers. I was there with 6 other friends and if you just want somewhere cheap to lay your head, then you probably can't get better value. If you are a couple on a smaller budget, it is also ideal. Breakfast is 9 euros if booked when you check in (11.50 otherwise), but we never took it so we could lie in. There is a small supermarket just 100 metres up the road and plenty of eateries to get breakfast at. One thing to note, is they have flyers in the lounge that entitle you to a free dinner at a nearby cafe/restaurant on the purchase of any drink. Unforutantely, we didn't see this until our last morning! There is also free wifi from all the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AMP2008London
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Barcelona. Last time we stayed at the H10 Hotel del Pi which has larger, brighter rooms but is more expensive - so you get what you pay for. Having said that, the Hesperia Metropol is in an excellent location, close to public transport. (We read some reviews that said it was 10 mins to a Metro station - must have been written by a snail). The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, although their first night recommendation for a restaurant was not great - find your own local places - there are plenty around. Our room was at the front and overlooked the street, so it was a little noisy when the bar opposite emptied, but we heard no noise from adjoining rooms, the corridor or those above us which surprised me, and our friends who had a room facing an inside courtyard had no noise at all. My only gripe was that the rooms vere rather dark and the lighting poor. Taking the lamp shades off the lights helped a bit. We had also seen some reviews that the area was not safe - well we were 4 girls and we never felt threatened at any time of the day or night. Barcelona is a great city, and this is a good place to stay and see it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, just right for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: silentjeff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 26th and 27th of February 2008, just for a couple of nights away, having a few beers to be honest. My mate Neil did the booking. I think it came out at around £110 per room for the two nights. Reception was great, the desk staff were very polite and helpful. Spoke perfect English, much better than my Spanish :o) The hotel reminds me very much of a Travelodge/Holiday Inn Express. Clean, good size room for a couple of nights. Bathroom was very nice, spacious, had shampoo/shower gel, etc... Breakfast was cold meats, cheeses, rolls, boiled eggs, all self served buffet style, with coffee and fruit juices. Nice waiting room with big comfy leather sofas just off reception, almost dropped off on one at one point! Although that might've been the beers I'd had in the afternoon. As with pretty much any hotel you can hear sounds from other rooms, and the corridors outside, but it was no worse than many other hotels I've stayed in. For a good nights sleep I always pack earplugs if I'm not away with my girlfriend. Ideal location for the bars/restaurants around the old town, and for the marina area. I'd stay here again for another two night trip, location wise, for what we wanted (somewhere to crash at the end of the day) it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - good location far from the metro”
Reviews.Author: Kaer
Reviews.Content: The location is as good as the other reviews indicate, although it is worth mentioning that the nearest metro stations is a good 10 min walk away. We had specifically asked for a room with a real exterior window - we got this, but the noise from the street was noticeable at first floor. The room we had was very small, but clean and the comfort was ok. We went for the breakfast option, which is good value for the 10 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: S&JGill
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona and this hotel was great for my stay. The location is amazing, literally 2 minutes walk from La Rambla, a lot of people say this area is dodgy but as long as you don't walk around on your own it's fine and I never felt under threat going out for dinner at night, just try to stick to the busier roads rather than the small alleys. The hotel was extremely basic but clean which is the most important thing. We had a well equipped bathroom, a TV and a mini bar apart from tea making faciliites there was nothing more we needed. The staff are very helpful too. If you're looking for a budget hotel in Barcelona then this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “don't try swinging a cat”
Reviews.Author: lennyMiddlesbrough
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was no bigger than a cupboard, not value for money. Bigger rooms are available, make sure you get one of these.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: aussiebrummie
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of La Rambla and many of the sights. Great restaurants nearby. Room clean and comfortable, certainly large enough by European standards. A bit of noise from restaurant underneath until late although not too bad , I still managed to get off to sleep ok. Excellent value for money. Staff very friendly and helpful. In a narrow street but well lit and seemed safe enough to me. I will defintely stop again

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chicago_realtor
Reviews.Content: Do not go here. I chose this hotel based on the reviews and was disappointed. To begin, the location...it was on a dingy street in a neighborhood I did not feel safe in! Later I ask the cleaning lady if this is a safe neighborhood and she said it's very old and I shouldn't walk it alone. Then the internet was 5 euros for 30 mins to use (ripoff!). The room: dingy! We had 2 twin beds that gave you a walking circumfrance of 6" along the table and couldn't open the dresser doors. We had to push the beds another 2 feet to access the safe. Bathroom had a dingy smell with no ventilation and you can tell the ceiling was painted over I don't know how many times. The beds were terrible uncomfortable as were the linens. The internet was down 1 night and didn't know when it will be back up, the elevator another and the staff just smiled and said " in 10 min it should be working" NOT! I wanted to upload fotos from my digital camera and their computer was something I used in high school that didn't read the USB and no media slot! Stick to the Internet Cafe that was on adjacent to the rambla next to their plaza in the middle of the Ramblas. Their PCs were modern. The cheapest one was on the Ramblas next to the Subway. 1.80 euro for an hour. Travel within Spain, book via Spainair, Vueling or Easy Jet. They are the cheapest. We flew from Madrid for 60 euros. Sweet! The location was a long walk to the Metro. I would never stay at the place. The halls smelled of mildew and the linens must be washed in something horrible as my skin itched the whole day. Definitely stay along the Ramblas or up by Placa Catalunya! Their fotos look nicer than the real thing!

HotelInfo.Name: Hesperia Metropol
HotelInfo.Address: Ample 31, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
